document_data.name: Toad
document_data.mainbody: A '''toad''' or '''frog'''—the terms were more or less interchangeable{{Cite dragon/247/Dragon's Bestiary: The Anurans|88}}—was any of a number of species of amphibians characterized by dry, leathery skin; short legs; and bumpy skin.
document_data.History:
The [[wizard]] [[Dhaerivus]] was once turned into a toad at a [[magefair]].

In [[1358 DR]], the wizard [[Regweld Harpell]] was experimenting with merging horses and frogs. He named his first "success" [[Puddlejumper]].

Species.[[Archer frog]]: A mottled green and brown variety of the giant frog.{{Cite dragon/247/Dragon's Bestiary: The Anurans|89}}
Species.Bullfrog: A type of large frog found in the [[Vast Swamp]].<ref>
Species.[[Fire toad]]: A toad that lived in warm climates and dry regions, such as parts of the [[Hordelands]].
Species.[[Ghoul frog]]: A creature with translucent skin and large, black pupils.{{Cite dragon/247/Dragon's Bestiary: The Anurans|90}}
Species.[[Giant frog]]: Otherwise known as a giant toad, was a monstrous variety of the mundane creature.{{Cite dragon/258/Voaraghamanthar, "the Black Death"}}
Species.[[Leech toad]]: A black nocturnal toad with bright red eyes.{{Cite dragon/247/Dragon's Bestiary: The Anurans|91}}
Species.[[Neotropical toad]]: A toad with horizontal pupils and poison glands behind the eyes.{{cite dragon/237/The Dragon's Bestiary: Venomous!|48}}
Species.Redeye frog: A species of frog that was endemic to the [[Farsea Marshes]].
Species.[[Spined toad]]: A toad that looked like a cross between a giant toad and a [[hedgehog]].{{Cite dragon/247/Dragon's Bestiary: The Anurans|92}}

Ecology.Habitats: Toads were found in the [[Calim Desert]], the [[Great Swamp of Rethild]], and at [[Toad Knoll]] in [[Shadowdale]].
Ecology.Usage:
Toads could serve as [[familiar]]s to [[mage]]s.

Frogs were eaten in many regional dishes, such as [[brassla]].

Toad skin could be pressed and used to assemble [[book]]s out of. The toad leather allowed such books to remain waterproof and lowed its aging and degradation in humid areas. One such book was the ''[[Lady Faveretti's Cookery Handbook for Erudite Young Girls (with an appendix on Poisoning for Beginners)]]'', a ''[[spellbook]]'' for aspiring lady magicians of the [[Blade Kingdoms]].

document_data.Trivia: * Geographical locations were sometimes named after toads, such as [[Toad Knoll]] and [[Toadsquat Mountains]].<ref>
